name: codebraid-preview
description: Preview Markdown documents with Pandoc.  Optionally execute code blocks and inline code with Codebraid, using Jupyter kernels or its built-in code execution system.
license: See license in LICENSE.txt (BSD 3-Clause except as noted otherwise)

codebraid.preview.maxPreviews.description: Maximum number of preview panels allowed concurrently.

codebraid.preview.minBuildInterval.description: Minimum interval between document builds in milliseconds.

codebraid.preview.scrollPreviewWithEdito.description: Scroll preview to sync with editor

codebraid.preview.scrollEditorWithPrevie.description: Scroll editor to sync with preview

codebraid.preview.pandoc.fromFormat.description: Pandoc source format (`--from=FORMAT`).  Currently, only "commonmark_x" supports scroll sync.

items.description: Pandoc option in `--option`, `--option=VALUE`, or `--option VALUE` form.  Options are evaluated within a shell, so spaces must be quoted.
items.patternErrorMessage: One option (including any value) per line/array element.  Options are evaluated within a shell, so spaces must be quoted.  Specify source format in "pandocFromFormat".

codebraid.preview.pandoc.options.description: Pandoc command-line options.  In the settings GUI, one option per line (for example, `--filter FILTER`).  In `settings.json`, an array with one option per element (for example, `["--filter FILTER"]`).  Options are evaluated within a shell, so spaces must be quoted.

codebraid.preview.pandoc.previewDefaults.patternErrorMessage: Must be a file name without a path to the file.
codebraid.preview.pandoc.previewDefaults.description: Special Pandoc defaults file in document directory.  If it exists and defines "input-files", the preview will automatically work with all files in a multi-file document.

codebraid.preview.pandoc.showRaw.description: Display a verbatim representation of non-HTML raw content `{=format}` in the preview.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
